content:
MetaColumn Class

In this Article

Represents a database column that is used by Dynamic Data.

Syntax

Declaration

public class MetaColumn : System.Web.DynamicData.IFieldFormattingOptions

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • System.Object
  • MetaColumn

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
,
Equals(Object,Object)
,
GetHashCode()
,
GetType()
,
MemberwiseClone()
,
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)

Remarks

In ASP.NET Dynamic Data applications, the MetaColumn class represents a database field. The MetaColumn class lets you retrieve information about the data field such as type and metadata information.

You can retrieve the table that the data field belongs to by using the Table property. You can also retrieve the data model by using the Model property.

Constructors summary

MetaColumn(MetaTable,ColumnProvider)

Initializes a new instance of the MetaColumn class.

Properties summary

AllowInitialValue

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a column enables a value to be inserted.
ApplyFormatInEditMode

Gets a value that indicates whether the formatting string specified by the stem.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn.DataFormatString* property is applied to field values when the data-bound control that contains the data field that is represented by the MetaColumn object is in edit mode.
Attributes

Gets the collection of metadata attributes that apply to the data field represented by the MetaColumn object.
ColumnType

Gets the data field type.
ConvertEmptyStringToNull

Gets a value that indicates whether empty string values ("") are automatically converted to null values when the data field is updated in the data source.
DataFormatString

Gets the string that specifies the display format for the field value.
DataTypeAttribute

Gets the DataTypeAttribute attribute that is applied to the data field.
DefaultValue

Gets the default value for the data field.
Description

Gets the description for the data field.
DisplayName

Gets the display name for the data field.
EntityTypeProperty

Gets an object that contains attributes of the property that represents the data field in the entity type.
FilterUIHint

Gets the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.FilterUIHintAttribute.FilterUIHint* value that is used for the column.
HtmlEncode

Gets a value that indicates whether field values are HTML-encoded before they are displayed in a data-bound control.
IsBinaryData

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field contains binary data.
IsCustomProperty

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field exists in the database.
IsFloatingPoint

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field is a floating-point type.
IsForeignKeyComponent

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field is part of a foreign key.
IsGenerated

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field value is automatically generated in the database.
IsInteger

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field type is an integer type.
IsLongString

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field type can contain long strings.
IsPrimaryKey

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field is part of the table's primary key.
IsReadOnly

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field is read-only.
IsRequired

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field requires a value.
IsString

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field type is a string type.
MaxLength

Gets a value that indicates the maximum length of data that can be stored in the data field.
Model

Gets the MetaModel object that represents the data model that this data field belongs to.
Name

Gets the name of the data field.
NullDisplayText

Gets the caption that is displayed for a field when the field's value is null.
Prompt

Gets a value that can be used as a watermark in the UI that is bound to data in the column.
Provider

Gets the abstraction provider object that is used to generate the MetaColumn object.
RequiredErrorMessage

Gets the error message that is displayed when the data field requires a value but its value is empty.
Scaffold

Gets a value that indicates whether the data field should be displayed.
ShortDisplayName

Gets the short name for the column.
SortExpression

Gets the expression that is used to determine the sort order for the data field.
Table

Gets the MetaTable object that represents the table that the data field belongs to.
TypeCode

Gets the type of the data field.
UIHint

Gets the name of the field template specified for the data field.

Methods summary

BuildAttributeCollection()

Gets the attribute collection.
Initialize()

Initializes data that might not be available when the constructor is called.
ResetMetadata()

Clears cached column metadata.
ToString()

Gets the data field name.

Constructors

  • MetaColumn(MetaTable,ColumnProvider)

    Initializes a new instance of the MetaColumn class.

    public MetaColumn (System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable table, System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider columnProvider);

    Parameters

    • table
      MetaTable

      The meta table that contains the column.

    • columnProvider
      ColumnProvider

      The column provider.

Properties

  • AllowInitialValue

    Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a column enables a value to be inserted.

    public bool AllowInitialValue { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the column enables a value to be inserted; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The default value is false when the column is read-only and true when the column is not read-only. The default value can be overridden by using the EditableAttribute attribute.

  • ApplyFormatInEditMode

    Gets a value that indicates whether the formatting string specified by the stem.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn.DataFormatString* property is applied to field values when the data-bound control that contains the data field that is represented by the MetaColumn object is in edit mode.

    public bool ApplyFormatInEditMode { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the formatting string specified by the stem.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn.DataFormatString* property is applied to field values when the data-bound control that contains the data field that is represented by the MetaColumn object is in edit mode; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The ApplyFormatInEditMode property verifies if a DisplayFormatAttribute attribute is applied to the data field and retrieves the value of the ApplyFormatInEditMode property. If a DisplayFormatAttribute attribute is not found, this property verifies if a DataTypeAttribute attribute is applied to retrieve formatting information.

  • Attributes

    Gets the collection of metadata attributes that apply to the data field represented by the MetaColumn object.

    public System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection Attributes { get; }

    Property Value

    • AttributeCollection

      The collection of metadata attributes that apply to the data field represented by the MetaColumn object.

  • ColumnType

    Gets the data field type.

    public Type ColumnType { get; }

    Property Value

    • Type

      The data field type.

    Remarks

    The ColumnType property returns the common language runtime (CLR) type of the data field.

  • ConvertEmptyStringToNull

    Gets a value that indicates whether empty string values ("") are automatically converted to null values when the data field is updated in the data source.

    public bool ConvertEmptyStringToNull { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if empty string values are automatically converted to null values when the data field is updated in the data source; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The ConvertEmptyStringToNull property verifies if a DisplayFormatAttribute attribute is applied to the data field and retrieves the value of the ConvertEmptyStringToNull property. If a DisplayFormatAttribute attribute is not found, this property verifies if a DataTypeAttribute attribute is applied to retrieve formatting information.

  • DataFormatString

    Gets the string that specifies the display format for the field value.

    public string DataFormatString { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The string that specifies the display format for the field value.

    Remarks

    The DataFormatString property verifies if a DisplayFormatAttribute attribute is applied to the data field and retrieves the value of the DataFormatString property. If a DisplayFormatAttribute attribute is not found, this property verifies if a DataTypeAttribute attribute is applied to retrieve formatting information.

  • DataTypeAttribute

    Gets the DataTypeAttribute attribute that is applied to the data field.

    public System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.DataTypeAttribute DataTypeAttribute { get; }

    Property Value

    • DataTypeAttribute

      The DataTypeAttribute attribute that is applied to the data field.

  • DefaultValue

    Gets the default value for the data field.

    public object DefaultValue { get; }

    Property Value

    • System.Object

      The default value for the data field.

    Remarks

    The DefaultValue property is typically used to pre-populate the field value when a new entry is created. This property verifies if a DefaultValueAttribute attribute is applied to the data field and retrieves the value of the Value property.

  • Description

    Gets the description for the data field.

    public virtual string Description { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The description for the data field.

    Remarks

    The Description property verifies if a DescriptionAttribute attribute is applied to the data field and retrieves the value of the Description property.

  • DisplayName

    Gets the display name for the data field.

    public virtual string DisplayName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The display name for the data field.

    Remarks

    The DisplayName property returns the friendly display name for the data field if one has been set, or the field name if no display name has been specified. The DisplayName property verifies if a friendly display name has been set by checking if a DisplayNameAttribute attribute is applied to the data field.

  • EntityTypeProperty

    Gets an object that contains attributes of the property that represents the data field in the entity type.

    public System.Reflection.PropertyInfo EntityTypeProperty { get; }

    Property Value

    • PropertyInfo

      An object that contains attributes of the property that represents the data field in the entity type.

  • FilterUIHint

    Gets the stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.FilterUIHintAttribute.FilterUIHint* value that is used for the column.

    public string FilterUIHint { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The stem.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.FilterUIHintAttribute.FilterUIHint* value that is used for the column.

  • HtmlEncode

    Gets a value that indicates whether field values are HTML-encoded before they are displayed in a data-bound control.

    public bool HtmlEncode { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true in all cases.

  • IsBinaryData

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field contains binary data.

    public bool IsBinaryData { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field contains binary data; otherwise, false.

  • IsCustomProperty

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field exists in the database.

    public bool IsCustomProperty { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field does not exist in the database; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    Use the IsCustomProperty property to determine whether a data field is in the database or if it is an extra property that was added to the data context object.

  • IsFloatingPoint

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field is a floating-point type.

    public bool IsFloatingPoint { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field is a floating-point type; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The types float, double, and decimal are floating point types.

  • IsForeignKeyComponent

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field is part of a foreign key.

    public bool IsForeignKeyComponent { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field is part of a foreign key; otherwise, false.

  • IsGenerated

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field value is automatically generated in the database.

    public bool IsGenerated { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field value is automatically generated in the database; otherwise, false.

  • IsInteger

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field type is an integer type.

    public bool IsInteger { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field type is an integer type; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The types byte, short, int, and long are integer types.

  • IsLongString

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field type can contain long strings.

    public bool IsLongString { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field type can contain long strings; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The SQL types text, ntext, varchar, and nvarchar can contain long strings. The value of the IsLongString property is used to determine whether the TextBox or TextArea field template is displayed to enable users to modify the field value.

  • IsPrimaryKey

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field is part of the table's primary key.

    public bool IsPrimaryKey { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field is part of the table's primary key; otherwise, false.

  • IsReadOnly

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field is read-only.

    public virtual bool IsReadOnly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field is read-only; otherwise, false.

  • IsRequired

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field requires a value.

    public bool IsRequired { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field requires a value; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The Description property verifies if a RequiredAttribute attribute is applied to the data field or if the database schema contains information about the data field being required in the database to determine whether the data field requires a value.

  • IsString

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field type is a string type.

    public bool IsString { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field type is a string type; otherwise, false.

  • MaxLength

    Gets a value that indicates the maximum length of data that can be stored in the data field.

    public int MaxLength { get; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      The maximum length of data that can be stored in the data field.

    Remarks

    The MaxLength property verifies if a StringLengthAttribute attribute is applied to the data field and retrieves the value of the MaximumLength property. If a StringLengthAttribute attribute is not applied to the data field, the MaxLength property uses the database type to retrieve the maximum length allowed.

  • Model

    Gets the MetaModel object that represents the data model that this data field belongs to.

    public System.Web.DynamicData.MetaModel Model { get; }

    Property Value

    • MetaModel

      An object that represents the data model that this data field belongs to.

  • Name

    Gets the name of the data field.

    public string Name { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the data field.

  • NullDisplayText

    Gets the caption that is displayed for a field when the field's value is null.

    public string NullDisplayText { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The caption that is displayed for a field when the field's value is null.

    Remarks

    The NullDisplayText property verifies if a DisplayFormatAttribute attribute is applied to the data field and retrieves the value of the NullDisplayText property. If a DisplayFormatAttribute attribute is not found, this property verifies if a DataTypeAttribute attribute is applied to retrieve formatting information.

  • Prompt

    Gets a value that can be used as a watermark in the UI that is bound to data in the column.

    public virtual string Prompt { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      A value that can be used as a watermark in the UI that is bound to data in the column.

    Remarks

    A null or empty string can be returned.

    Example

    This property is set by the DisplayAttribute attribute in the column's definition in the meta class for the data entity.

  • Provider

    Gets the abstraction provider object that is used to generate the MetaColumn object.

    public System.Web.DynamicData.ModelProviders.ColumnProvider Provider { get; }

    Property Value

    • ColumnProvider

      The abstraction provider object that is used to generate the MetaColumn object.

  • RequiredErrorMessage

    Gets the error message that is displayed when the data field requires a value but its value is empty.

    public string RequiredErrorMessage { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The error message that is displayed when the data field requires a value but its value is empty.

  • Scaffold

    Gets a value that indicates whether the data field should be displayed.

    public virtual bool Scaffold { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the data field should be displayed; otherwise, false.

    Remarks

    The Scaffold property indicates whether a data field should be displayed when it is automatically generated by ASP.NET Dynamic Data. This property verifies if a ScaffoldColumnAttribute attribute is applied to the data field and returns the value of the Scaffold property. If a ScaffoldColumnAttribute attribute is not applied to the data field, Dynamic Data uses the following rules to determine whether to display the column:

    • If a UIHintAttribute attribute is applied to the data field, the data field is displayed. This rule overrides all the other rules.

    • If the value of the IsForeignKeyComponent property is true, the data field is not displayed. This occurs because Dynamic Data handles foreign-key fields in a different way and will not typically display the foreign-key field value.

    • If the value of the IsGenerated property is true, the data field is not displayed. Typically fields that are automatically generated in the database do not contain relevant information. Make sure that you apply the UIHintAttribute attribute to the data field, if the data field must be displayed.

    • If the value of the IsCustomProperty property is true, the data field is not displayed.

  • ShortDisplayName

    Gets the short name for the column.

    public virtual string ShortDisplayName { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The short name for the column.

    Remarks

    This property is provided for GridView control and other controls where a short name is needed because of limited column-header space.

  • SortExpression

    Gets the expression that is used to determine the sort order for the data field.

    public string SortExpression { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The expression that is used to determine the sort order for the data field.

  • Table

    Gets the MetaTable object that represents the table that the data field belongs to.

    public System.Web.DynamicData.MetaTable Table { get; }

    Property Value

    • MetaTable

      An object that represents the table that the data field belongs to.

  • TypeCode

    Gets the type of the data field.

    public TypeCode TypeCode { get; }

    Property Value

    • TypeCode

      The type of the data field.

    Remarks

    The TypeCode property value is derived from the value of the ColumnType property.

  • UIHint

    Gets the name of the field template specified for the data field.

    public virtual string UIHint { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the field template specified for the data field.

    Remarks

    The UIHint property verifies if a UIHintAttribute attribute is applied to the data field and retrieves the value of the UIHint property. If a UIHintAttribute attribute is not applied to the data field, the UIHint property returns an empty string.

Methods

  • BuildAttributeCollection()

    Gets the attribute collection.

    protected virtual System.ComponentModel.AttributeCollection BuildAttributeCollection ();

    Returns

    • AttributeCollection

      The attribute collection.

    Remarks

    You must call the BuildAttributeCollection method before you access the Attributes property.

  • Initialize()

    Initializes data that might not be available when the constructor is called.

    protected virtual void Initialize ();

    Remarks

    This method cannot be called directly. To customize initialization, you can derive from this class and override the Initialize method. If you override this method, call the base control's Initialize method.

  • ResetMetadata()

    Clears cached column metadata.

    public void ResetMetadata ();

    Remarks

    The column metadata is information that is derived from attributes and that is cached for performance. Calling this method clears the metadata cache for this column. The metadata cache is rebuilt the next time any information that is derived from metadata is requested.

  • ToString()

    Gets the data field name.

    public override string ToString ();

    Returns

    • String

      The data field name, which is the string representation of the column.
